raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences/rows that meet the criteria:


Compounds that gave an IC50 of greater than 5 μM are represented by "*," compounds that gave an IC50 of between about 1 and 4.9 μM are 
 represented by "**," and compounds exhibiting IC50's of less than 0.9 μM are represented by "***."
c. Concentration necessary to inhibit DNA-protein binding by 50% (EC50) as determined using a dose response analysis. 
Note that there are very few sentences that contain all the required information. Most of the text is descriptive and does not contain specific molecule names, bioactivity metrics, numeric values, and units.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:


An electrophoretic mobility shift assay (EMSA) using 0.1 M (<sup>33</sup>P)DNA, 5 nM SoxS and 50 ug/ml of transcription factor modulating compound was used to study activity of the compound to interrupt DNA-protein interactions in vitro.
